settings.title: Are hard shell blue crabs a sustainable, eco-friendly seafood choice?
settings.content: Yes! Blue crabs mature and reproduce VERY quickly. The domestic United States Blue Crab fishery is very sustainable. Also, Blue Crabs are caught in traps that are eco-friendly, in that this method results in very little bycatch and damage to natural ocean and bay habitats.

settings.title: Are blue crabs a healthy seafood choice?
settings.content: Absolutely. Crabmeat is high-protein and crabmeat is virtually fat-free. Crabs are also a great source of Vitamin B12. About three ounces of crab meat contains a full day's allowance of vitamin B12.

settings.title: How is ordering seafood online environmentally friendly?
settings.content:
Ordering seafood online is a great way to reduce individual fuel consumption. One FedEx truck packed with hundreds of orders results in fewer cars driving to the seafood market or grocery store.

CrabPlace.com seafood selections spend less than 36 hours between the docks next to our facility in Crisfield and your table—the whole time in carefully packed, specially designed coolers—which compares favorably to the massive energy consumption required by traditional retailers who keep seafood in refrigerated showcases under warm lights, usually for days at a time.
